column4: Question:  I'm trying to install Ubuntu 5.10.  When it gets to the stage where it is "Starting Partitioner", it gets 100% and then goes to a blue screen and hangs there.  If I hit Ctrl+C, it starts the partitioner again and hangs at 52% everytime.

I'm pretty positive it has something to do with my hard drives (first one in particular).  I have 2 hard drives.  One is a 40GB hard drive with Windows installed on it.  The second is a brand new 250 GB hard drive with entirely unallocated space.
have a look at wiki.ubuntu.com/BootOptions  or wiki.ubuntu.com/PaulsKludge no promises but you might strike it lucky
make sure you have themn set as master and slave and work from there
Yes, I have the jumper for the 40GB set as Master and the 250GB set as Slave
I want to leave the 40GB as is, and partition off part of the 250GB drive for Linux
no cable select, and make sure that the cd is master on ide 2 (assuming that it is on ide 2)

you will need to get a terminal, Applications, Accessories, Terminal, and in there type the bit between the arrow heads >>sudo fdisk -l<< get that output and go to https://paste.ubuntu-nl.org with it and enter it there and then give the url of that page in this channel
so get yourself the live CD that comes with ubuntu and use that
well, I've used the LiveCD for a little bit and decided to go ahead and permanently install
so get the install CD and start the install
did you have a look at wiki.ubuntu.com/BootOptions  or wiki.ubuntu.com/PaulsKludge ?
i've glanced at them, i will read more thorouhgly
go for it now - and no that would not stop it
as CyaniCs|testing suggested there, that is a good idea, give it a shot and come back to us
